titles: Market Turmoil: Stock Indexes Dive Amid Trump-Fed Tensions
Rexas Finance and Pepe Poised for Greatest 2025 Crypto Gains
descriptions: U.S. stock indexes fell over 3% amid President Trump's criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Trump's continued attacks on Powell's monetary policy raised investor concerns about the Fed's independence. Safe-haven assets surged, with gold hitting a record high. Crypto saw mixed moves, while oil prices dipped.

Shiba Inu, Pepe, and Rexas Finance are spotlighted in the cryptocurrency market's 2025 growth prospects. While PEPE gains popularity as a meme coin and shows impressive market momentum, RXS leads with practical applications in asset tokenization, AI-driven NFTs, and DeFi, promising significant future returns.

titles: Bitcoin emerges from bear market as traders eye $US125,000
descriptions: The cryptocurrency is starting to trade more like gold rather than riskier assets such as stocks, enhancing its appeal in times of financial stress, analysts say.

titles: Mint Primer: Why Sebi wants investors to skip opinion trading
descriptions: Opinion (or event) trading apps allow users to place bids on the outcome of an event, such as the outcome of a cricket match, the value of assets such as Bitcoin.

titles: Dubliner, 24, set for trial accused of helping 'darknet market' gang launder €14m in cryptocurrency criminal proceeds
descriptions: A DUBLIN man is to stand trial accused of aiding a “darknet” criminal organisation in laundering €14m in cryptocurrency crime proceeds.Kevin Dan

titles: Coinbase to buy Deribit in $2.9 billion deal, expanding crypto options market
Bitcoin surges past $100,000 mark on US-UK trade deal
Bitcoin Jumps Over 23% In A Month, Crosses $99,000: Why Are Cryptocurrencies Rising, Should You Buy?
descriptions: Shares of Coinbase, which have lost nearly 21% of their value in 2025, jumped 5.7%. The deal consists of $700 million in cash and 11 million shares of Coinbase's Class A common stock, the company said in a blog post.

By midday, bitcoin was trading at $101,402.19, a 4.8% gain on the day. The world's biggest cryptocurrency has clawed its way back into positive territory for the year, although it remains off the all-time high above $109,000 reached in January.
Bitcoin Price Today, May 8: Bitcoin rose 2.59% to $99,025 on May 08, 2025, amid positive US-China trade talks and Trump's major trade deal announcement. Ethereum, XPR, and Solana also saw gains.

titles: Bitcoin Reclaims $100,000 Psychological Mark, Up 37% In 1 Month, Why Is Cryptocurrency Rising?
descriptions: Bitcoin price surpasses $100,000 amid global trade optimism, reaching $102,901.46. Institutional adoption and strategic reserves boost credibility.

titles: 6 Crypto Exchanges in India to Keep Your Funds Safe
descriptions: India’s cryptocurrency market has matured rapidly, with millions of investors seeking secure, transparent, and reliable platforms for trading digital assets.

titles: Stock and crypto trading site eToro prices IPO at $52 per share
Coinbase to join S&P 500 next week in crypto-market milestone
A watershed moment for crypto industry, analysts say
Trump family's bitcoin mining venture to go public - as Trump crypto interests grow
descriptions: Israel-based stock brokerage platform eToro said it has priced shares for its IPO at $52, which would value the company at about $4.2 billion
Coinbase Global Inc., the largest US cryptocurrency exchange, will be added to the S&P 500 Index in the latest milestone for the booming digital-asset industry.
On Monday evening, S&P Dow Jones Indices said Coinbase will be added to the benchmark S&P 500 stock index before trading begins on May 19.
The president's son Eric Trump says he wants to create "the most investable Bitcoin accumulation platform in the market."

titles: Edgen Launches “AI Super App,” Democratizing Institutional-Grade Crypto Market Intelligence
descriptions: Hong Kong, Hong Kong, 14th May 2025, Chainwire

titles: Novogratz's Galaxy Digital opens trading on the Nasdaq at $23.50
descriptions: Mike Novogratz’s crypto firm Galaxy Digital began trading on the Nasdaq, completing a four-year effort to secure a U.S. listing despite regulatory hurdles.
